intro: Sisyrinchium excisum, commonly known as the cutleaf blue-eyed grass, is a member of the Iridaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States, typically found in moist woodlands and stream banks. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of blue to violet flowers with prominent yellow centers. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is adapted to partial to full shade. Sisyrinchium excisum is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
